MasterAnswered on 22 Mar 2019Before you start investing, make sure you have an emergency fund set aside, and make sure you have insurance.Read more investment related stuff to learn more. If you can, go for investment courses (check their reviews before applying. some may be a scam).Manage your emotions. Don't let your emotions control your decisions on when to buy/sell.Have a plan. How long is your investment horizon? How much are you willing to lose? How should you allocate your portfolio?Read Seedly for some tips regarding investments. Seedly has a lot of blog posts teaching us some basic tips.0 comments1
